title: Cuttlegear
content:
Cuttlegear is a gear brand in the Splatoon series.

Unlike most other brands, it does not have increased or decreased chances of getting certain abilities.

- 1 Description

1.1 Logo

- 1.1 Logo

- 2 Gear

- 3 Weapons

- 4 Gallery

- 5 Trivia

- 6 Etymology

6.1 Names in other languages

- 6.1 Names in other languages

- 1.1 Logo

- 6.1 Names in other languages

Cuttlegear is a brand primarily dedicated to producing gear obtainable from single-player campaigns or other non-commercial sources, which cannot be purchased or ordered from another player, although version 3.0.0 in Splatoon 2 introduced Cuttlegear clothing for sale in shops.

In Splatoon and Splatoon 2, Cuttlegear is heavily implied both by its name and produced gear items to be associated with Cap'n Cuttlefish and the New Squidbeak Splatoon. A Sunken Scroll in Splatoon 3 features an official document of the New Squidbeak Splatoon with the Cuttlegear logo on it, seemingly confirming this connection.

In Splatoon, the brand has an entirely black logo, depicting a stylized squid icon surrounded by circular "waves", with two Bamboozlers arranged in a crossbones-esque way underneath the squid icon.

Beginning in Splatoon 2, the logo has changed from black to a dark navy blue, though it is otherwise identical.

For the category page, see Category:Cuttlegear.

Despite being created by Sheldon as a homage to Cap'n Cuttlefish and his own grandfather, 2 weapons under the Ammo Knights and Sheldon's Picks brands are marked with Cuttlegear stickers:

- Bamboozler 14 Mk II (with the same sticker also appearing in the bottom right corner of the weapon icon)

- Bamboozler 14 Mk III

However, the Recycled Brella 24 Mk II has the Sorella brand.

- Recycled Brella 24 Mk II

- Cuttlegear's black logo, as seen in Splatoon.

- Vertical version of the logo.

- An Inkling wearing Cuttlegear gear. The brand logo is visible on the Legendary Cap and Bamboozler 14 Mk II.

- Another Inkling wearing Cuttlegear gear. The brand logo is also visible on the tag on the Octo Tee.

- The Cuttlegear Logo on the back of the Old-Timey Hat.

- The Cuttlegear logo on the Old-Timey Clothes gear's medallion.

- The Cuttlegear logo on the Old-Timey Shoes.

- The Cuttlegear logo on the Black Cuttlegear LS' tag.

- The Cuttlegear logo on one of the Fresh Octo Tee's tags.

- The Cuttlegear logo on the Octo Layered LS tag.

- The Cuttlegear logo on the back of the Octarian Retro.

- The Cuttlegear logo is also visible on the base of DJ Octavio's snowglobe.

- The Cuttlegear logo is also seen around Tentakeel Outpost on banners and Cuttlefish Cabin.

- The Cuttlegear logo on Marie's umbrella.

- The Cuttlegear logo on a banner at Cuttlefish Cabin.

- Gear introduced in Side Order is still produced by Cuttlegear, despite the New Squidbeak Splatoon being entirely uninvolved with its story.

- Apart from the amiibo brand itself, Cuttlegear is the only other brand to produce gear provided by amiibo.

Cuttlegear is a portmanteau of "Cuttlefish" and "gear".
